job_description:
We are an large plastics manufacturing company with locations across North America. We have a dynamic and growing organization that works to place employee's first.

Axium prides itself as being the best in class supplier to its customers by having the best processes, people and technologies.

Position Summary: Blenders are responsible for the materials required for production and/or packaging of plastics bottles at Axium Plastics.

Responsibilities:

  • Fill machines with the proper resins according to the specific job
  • Experience using pallet jacks
  • Transports materials and items from storage to production areas or other designated areas
  • Loads, maintains, cleans, and cares for hoppers, dryers, and loaders.
  • Maintain the work area and equipment in a clean and orderly condition and follow prescribed safety regulations
  • Perform related duties as required by supervision
  • Prefer previous experiences in plastics packaging
  • Additional duties as required

Physical Demands:

  • May be required to stand for long periods of time
  • May involve some repetitive motions
  • Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds
  • Must be able to pull to 50 pounds
  • May also engage in frequent bending, stooping, squatting, pushing and pulling of parts and part containers
  • Requirements:
  • Understand and follow basic verbal and written instructions
  • Effectively communicate information and respond to questions from various levels within the organization
  • Possess basic mathematical skills: addition, subtraction, multiplication and division
  • Perform basic visual quality inspections on products
  • Maintain the production pace of other team members
  • Utilize power tools and various equipment as needed to perform duties

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Life insurance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • forklift operator: 1 year (Preferred)
  • warehouse: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Remotely:

  • No

POSITION PURPOSE:

The Senior Retail Supervisor oversees and participates in all day-to day store activities including safety compliance, front end and backroom oversight of the store. The Senior Retail Supervisor is responsible to maximize sales, production and customer service and is a key holder responsible for store opening and closing activities as directed by the Store Manager and/or Assistant Manager. This position is a member of the Management Support Team.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES:

  • Follow safety policies and procedures ensuring maximum security and protection of all customers and company assets.
  • Ensure maximum customer satisfaction. Work cooperatively with all consumers, community groups, co-workers, and subordinates to promote the achievement of the company mission. Maintain strict confidentiality of all sensitive information concerning consumers and/or employees.
  • Achieve 100% or higher of weekly transaction value goal.
  • Achieve 100% or more of weekly revenue goal.
  • Achieve 100% or more of weekly textile, WEB and ASH production goals.
  • Handle Point of Sale and Accounting functions and transactions; responsible for store cash funds, banking, and accounting for overages and shortages. Performs necessary record keeping, daily reports, and reporting of money and sales.
  • Responsible for planning and projection of donation needs to ensure and assist in achievement of production goals; ensuring maximum productivity of production staff; provide training and direction that ensures the highest level of customer service is offered to all.
  • Responsible to assist with the fulfillment of all production functions as needed.
  • Advise management staff of all progress, problems, and new development on a regular basis.
  • Ability to work varied hours/days as business dictates including opening and closing of location.
  • All other job duties as assigned (i.e. attending meetings, training).

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

A High School Diploma or G.E.D. along with a minimum of 1-2 years of related experience and/or training or equivalent combination of education and experience. Must have a valid drivers license. Ability to be a self starter with excellent oral and written communication skills along with extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications knowledge is required. Must be able to work independently, exercising judgment and initiative with minimal supervision.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to mechanical parts. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES AND REQUIREMENTS:

FINGER DEXTERITY: The ability to make fast, simple, repeated movements of the fingers, hands and wrists.

TALKING: Talking to others to convey information effectively and to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.

AVERAGE VISUAL ABILIITES: The ability to see details at close range (within a few feet of the observer). Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color, vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

PHYSICAL STRENGTH: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand and walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk of hear. The employee is regularly required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to sit. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 30 pounds.

INTENT AND FUNCTION OF POSITION DESCRIPTION:H

Position descriptions have been reviewed to ensure that only essential functions and basic duties have been included. Peripheral tasks, only incidentally related to each position, have been excluded. Requirements, skills, and abilities included have been determined to be the minimal standards required to successfully perform the positions. In no instance, however, should the duties, responsibilities, and requirements delineated be interpreted as all-inclusive. Supervisors may assign additional functions and requirements as deemed appropriate.


Position descriptions are not intended as and do not create employment contracts. Goodwill Industries of Delaware and Delaware County, maintains its status as an at-will employer.

Medical Biller / Collector

Newly Expanded Central Business Office is hiring for multiple positions
Join US and be a part of a dynamic TEAM!

We Believe in providing the highest quality of behavioral health care through demonstrating compassion, empathy and perseverance for our patients and their entrusting families.

**Only local candidates will be considered**

Carolina Dunes Behavioral Health is a 112-bed psychiatric residential and acute treatment facility specializing in children, adolescents, aging adults and their caregivers. Due to recent growth, we are seeking an experienced Medical Biller / Collector to join our professional team. Candidates with previous experience in Medicare/Medicaid billing preferred:

  • timely submission of clean medical claims and ongoing communication with insurance companies
  • collecting, cash posting, managing accounts payments, and working denials
  • must ensure that the hospital is in compliance with all state and federal laws and regulations and HIPAA

Qualifications:
The ideal candidate will possess 2 or more years of medical and/or physician billing experience.
Candidates must have extensive Medicare/Medicaid/MCO experience.
The ideal candidate will have strong MS Excel skills. Extra consideration is given to those with physician credentialing experience.

Carolina Dunes Behavioral Health offers the following benefit and reward options for full time staff:

  • Medical (choice of options), dental and vision insurance
  • Long and short-term disability
  • Paid time off (begins immediately, eligible following 90 days)
  • 401(k)

Note: In support of CDBH's quality requirements, we require a post-offer drug screen, physical, criminal background review and conduct original source verification of degrees/certifications of all candidates. Staff must be age 21 or older with minimum educational requirement of high school diploma.

Carolina Dunes Behavioral Health provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.

COVID-19 Considerations: To keep our staff and patients safe, we require all staff and visitors to complete a health screening and temperature check prior to entering the main facility. Surgical face masks are required and provided daily.

For more than 85 years, Terminix has built a reputation as one of the nation’s leading providers of termite and pest control services, safeguarding over 3 million homes and businesses against all types of pests in 47 states and 14 countries.

What is this role about?

Our Outside Sales Representatives play a key role at Terminix working with home owners to ensure they have the right products and services to protect their property from Termites and other pests.

What does a “Day-in-the-Life” look like?

Equipped with a company vehicle and excellent industry training, our Sales Reps are out in the communities Terminix serves meeting with new and existing customers. Sales appointments are typically pre-arranged with customers who have already expressed a need, giving a head start on the selling process. Your visit would typically begin with an inspection of the home to diagnose the issue (which may include getting in attics and crawlspaces) and be followed by a presentation of a recommended Service Plan to the customer.

Here are a few additional details of what you would be doing each day:

  • Documenting descriptions of property and recording accurate measurements of areas inspected
  • Estimating job costs and preparing Service Plan recommendations
  • Preparing appropriate specs and treating instructions for the agreed to Service Plan
  • Contacting customers after service is performed to ensure satisfaction and develop additional prospects
  • Prospecting and developing new sales leads
  • Continually building product knowledge and refining sales techniques

What do I need to be successful?

  • Being a high school graduate/having a GED and a valid driver’s license are both requirements
  • 6 to 12 months of sales experience or prior sales training is highly desired, but not required
  • You are highly motivated, have a strong work ethic and enjoy the selling process
  • You are able to build rapport easily and establish trust, leading to lasting customer relationships
  • You have strong communications skills – impersonal, written, presenting
  • You can effectively present information to customers one-on-one and in small groups
  • You have a good aptitude for basic math- necessary for doing calculations related to the sales process
  • Of course, given our business and the nature of this role, you should be comfortable working outside and in confined spaces like crawl spaces and attics
  • For safety reasons (rebreathers have be able to seal to your face) our Outside Sales Professionals aren’t able to have facial hair

Why should I choose Terminix?

In addition to being part of an iconic brand with a rich 85 year history, here are some other highlights of what we offer members of the Terminix Team.

  • Comprehensive training and licensure, all paid by the company
  • Highly competitive compensation program with uncapped commission potential – average earnings of$40-60,000 in first year with 100K+ earning potential
  • Company provided vehicle (that you can take home with you at night) and gas card
  • Opportunities for advancement and career growth – including paths into management level roles
  • Medical, dental and vision coverage + discounts on ServiceMaster brands
  • Short/long-term Disability and Life Insurance
  • Paid time off

Disclaimer

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of the work being performed by employees assigned to this classification; they are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for the position.

Terminix and ServiceMaster are committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

ServiceMaster companies are proud to be EOE.

job_description:
Axiom in Clearwater, Florida is looking for a Network Administrator.

Axiom develops software for the top architectural and engineering firms on the planet. Our customers design and build everything from highways and bridges to sports stadiums and so on.

For over 25 years we have been providing these firms with software that improves their productivity and efficiency, allowing them to get things done more accurately and quickly.

At Axiom, we take care of those who design the future.

Duties include:

  • Debugging software down to a very detailed level.
  • Investigating and handling things that do not make sense. Example: Why does a document behave differently when opened in two different versions of Word?
  • Creating and editing formulas, batch files and Visual Basic macros.
  • Handling backups and antivirus.
  • Assisting other teammates with password resets, granting permissions, software installations, and so on.

Required skills:

  • Excellent grammar and spelling.
  • Logical thinking and troubleshooting.
  • Able to think with and create long-term solutions.
  • Ability to research and propose the best hardware or software for any given situation.

This is a very software-focused position requiring extreme attention to detail and the ability to debug very specific (often unique) problems.

Contact Axiom today to apply — Great Purpose, Great Pay, Great Fun.

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime

  • High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Work Remotely:

  • No

  • Temperature screenings
  • Social distancing guidelines in place
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

job_title: IT End User Support Analyst I
job_description:
About Conduent:

Conduent delivers mission-critical services and solutions on behalf of businesses and governments – creating exceptional outcomes for its clients and the millions of people who count on them. Through people, process and technology, Conduent solutions and services automate workflows, improve efficiencies, reduce costs and enable revenue growth. It’s why most Fortune 100 companies and over 500 government entities depend on Conduent every day to manage their essential interactions and move their operations forward.

Conduent’s differentiated services and solutions improve experiences for millions of people every day, including two-thirds of all insured patients in the U.S., 11 million employees who use its HR Services, and nearly nine million people who travel through toll systems daily. Conduent’s solutions deliver exceptional outcomes for its clients including $17 billion in savings from medical bill review for workers compensation claims, up to 40% efficiency increase in HR operations, and up to 40% improvement in processing costs, while driving higher end-user satisfaction. Learn more at www.conduent.com.

job_description:
About Us

GKN Aerospace is the world’s leading multi-technology tier 1 aerospace supplier. With 50 manufacturing locations in 15 countries, we serve over 90% of the world’s aircraft and engine manufacturers. We design and manufacture innovative smart aerospace systems and components. Our technologies are used in aircraft ranging from the most used single aisle aircraft and the largest passenger planes in the world to business jets and the world’s advanced 5th generation fighter aircraft.

About the opportunity

GKN Aerospace is a global engineering business. Every time you travel by air almost anywhere in the world, it is likely that GKN is helping you on your way. We design, manufacture and service systems and components for original equipment manufacturers around the world. We are continuously evolving, pioneering new technologies and reinventing existing ones, stretching ourselves to be better in everything we do.

We are looking for people who want to make a difference, talented members with the skills and passions to become the best of the future in what they do.

Job Summary

The Chief Manufacturing Engineer is a leadership role responsible for manufacturing definition and ME related activties within a program or value stream.
Job Responsibilities

1) Responsible for delivering a manufacturing system definition that fulfils all requirements including;

2) Quality, H&S, design, producibility, business case etc.

3) the deployment of Lean tools for manufacturing and business processes

4) Introduction of new technology

5) all process / test requirements relating to the manufacturing system including

6) capability of the process and/or equipment

7) Accountable to meet the M.E. metrics (including Product safety, Quality and Delivery to Cost (NRC & RC))

8) Product development – selection of capable manufacturing processes including;

9) supporting Make v Buy & supplier selection

10) Is the technical interface with the nominated supply chain (from an M.E. standpoint)

11) Ensure adherence to all applicable Quality processes and procedures including;

a. all regulatory laws and guidelines are complied with

12) Responsible for defining the M.E. resource and schedule profiles required to ensure program completion on time / budget including;

13) Management the M.E. team and interfacing with the PM, IPT team and Customer

14) Ensure all M.E. related reviews (internal & external) are completed to schedule and that the inputs / outputs are managed to the defined process

15) Support the Chief Engineers on their technical reviews (internal & external) where required

16) Act as the M.E. point of contact internally & externally (with customers & supply chain)

17) Pursue personal development of skills and knowledge necessary for effective performance.

18) Perform other duties, tasks and responsibilities as assigned.

Required Education and Experience:
  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related discipline.
  • 10 years of manufacturing experience in composite part fabrication or composite/metallic assembly
  • 5 years of experience in project management of aerospace parts in a manufacturing environment.
  • Any equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Must be able to obtain a DOD Secret Clearance.
  • U.S. Person per ITAR regulations to comply with export compliance and site SSA requirements
Additional Experience and Qualifications:
  • Active DOD Secret Clearance preferred
  • Excellent customer relations skills including oral and written communications, presentations, and relationship development.
  • Experience with aerospace
  • Excellent written, verbal and collaboration skills
Diversity Inclusion and Belonging (DIB)

As a global engineering company, innovation is what differentiates us from our competitors and is central to our success.

A balance of cultures, ethnicities and genders help bring new ideas and creativity to GKN. We need people of different backgrounds, with different skills and perspectives to spark originality, imagination and creativeness in our teams around the world.

GKN is an equal opportunity employer.

We treat all our employees and applicants fairly and are committed to ensuring that there is no discrimination or harassment against any employee or qualified applicant on the grounds of age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_description:
Who We Are:

Founded in 1997, ChemoMetec is specialized in development, production and sale of high-quality cell counters and analyzers used in a broad range of areas. Our analysis tools are based on a patented, unique technology platform, which ensures a high-quality of analysis results, operational reliability, cost-effectiveness and simple use.

Who We Are Looking For:

We want to bring in an individual who has a forward-thinking mentality and a commitment to seeing a task through to the end. Someone who can bring new ideas and give input and feedback. Most importantly, someone who wants to grow with us. This is a chance for a real career, not just another job.

What You Will Do:

As our new Strategic Partnerships Account Manager, you will become part of our fantastic inside sales team. Your primary responsibilities are to assist the Strategic Partnerships Team in growing the company. You will play a central part for the in-office, day to day operations of the inside sales team. With the sale always in mind, you will identify and engaged new accounts. The position will include prospecting for new opportunities, account management within our CRM (Zoho), web scraping (using Sales Navigator) and other cold canvas functions vital to making the sale.

Our Expectations of You:

  • Identify new leads using established methods
  • Successfully build a pipeline of new business
  • Assist with marketing campaigns and social media
  • Accurately record and maintain customer information in our CRM database (Zoho)
  • Willingness to occasionally travel

Your Abilities:

  • Results focused with a natural drive for taking responsibility for your work
  • Ability to manage an array of customer accounts in a CRM (Exp. With Zoho or Salesforce prefered)
  • Passionate about creating value for your customers and experience in selling to their needs
  • Excellent presentation, organizational, and communication skills (oral and written)
  • Ability to prioritize and adjust your own resources and activities as needed
  • Awareness of improvement areas and readiness to develop in these areas
  • The ability to effectively manage multiple tasks in one day
  • Knowledge of key account management and relevant decision
  • Must be able to work both independently and as part of a dynamic team

Our Generous Benefits:

  • Highly Competitive Base Plus Commission (Base range is $58K-$65K BOE)
  • Extensive Training Program – sales, product & industry training and mentoring
  • Growth opportunities – we have a promote from within philosophy!
  • Comprehensive (and very affordable!) benefits package: Medical, Dental, Vision
  • Matching 401(k) plan
  • Generous Paid Time Off (10 Paid Holidays too!)
  • Company Phone, Laptop and more!
  • Relaxed Office Environment
  • Typical M-F work week; No Evenings, Flexible Hours

Your Experience:

  • Account Management: 1 year+ (Preferred)
  • Inside Sales: 1 year+ (Preferred)
  • Computer Literate: 1 year+ (Mandatory)

The Team Assistant provides clerical and administrative support in the achievement of the team goals and the objectives within the department.

Education/Training

Experience
Two (2) years clerical or secretarial experience.

Essential Functions

  • Maintains required files, statistics and reports in a streamlined manner to ensure current, accurate information is readily accessible.

Other Related Functions

  • Works as a team with all internal departments as well as all other Orlando Health team members to ensure the achievement department specific critical success factors.
  • Attends meetings and in-services as required.
  • Performs all other duties as assigned.

job_description:
We are looking for someone who has a real desire to work with pets and their owners. Experience is a plus, but we are willing to train the right recent grad. We are a privately owned by one of our doctors. There's no corporate nonsense, no drama and no old-fashioned hierarchy here. Our team of talented individuals collaborates as equals with one common goal: providing nothing but the best medical care to each and every patient.

Our technicians are provided with all of the tools to perform their job to the fullest. We have a paperless medical record-keeping system, digital radiology (including digital dental radiology), Idexx in house blood/urine analyzers, Cardell touch screen anesthesia monitor, Nikkon microscope and a doppler blood pressure monitor. Our doctors also provide plenty of guidance and support without micro-managing.

We offer highly competitive wages and a schedule that provides a great work-life balance. Our technicians get most weekends off (only have to work once every 3rd Saturday from 8am-1pm). We offer many other forms of compensation including paid time off, paid holidays, 401k with employer match up to 4%, discounted veterinary care for up to 4 pets, health/dental insurance with employer contribution and paid continuing education. We are also offering a $500 sign on bonus.

Interested? Email resume as an MS Word document or PDF file through Indeed

We kindly ask that you only communicate through Indeed/email rather than calling the hospital. We are curbside service only during the covid-19 pandemic, so we need to keep our phone lines open for clients.

Work Location:

  • One location

Company's website:

  • www.fayettevilleveterinaryhospital.com

Benefit Conditions:

Work Remotely:

  • No

ChenMed is transforming healthcare for seniors. We provide big answers to big problems in health care delivery.ChenMed is a full-risk primary care market leader with an innovative philosophy, unique physician culture and end-to-end customized technology. These things allow us to provide world-class primary care and coordinated care to the most vulnerable population moderate- to low-income seniors who have complex chronic diseases.

Through our innovative operating model, physician-led culture and empowering technology, we are able to drive key quality and cost outcomes that create value for patients, physicians and the overall health system.Our model allows us to practice medicine the way it should be practiced. By recruiting focused physicians and reducing their doctor-to-patient ratios, we increase patients face time during each monthly appointment and help foster stronger doctor-patient relationships. Our model also drives and enhances compliance with treatment plans.

As a result of our efforts, our patients realize lower hospital admissions. Their overwhelming response to our approach is reflected in our aggressive, organic growth and net promoter scores in the low to mid 90s, which is unheard of in any industry. Read more about our results and the value of the ChenMed model.

As a company, we are making a difference in the lives of seniors and the health care system overall.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provides general nursing care, under supervision, so that physicians and clinicians can focus on more specialized areas in patient care.
  • Assists with exams or procedures, patient education and maintenance of medical records.
  • Compiles patient health information, takes and records vital statistics, takes blood pressure and conducts other basic care treatments. Records patients' medical history and other information such as test results in the medical record.
  • Prepares patients for examination; assists physician with exams; explains treatment procedures, medications, diet and physicians' instructions to patient; provides disease specific patient education.
  • Draws blood (phlebotomy) and collects other lab specimens; performs waived lab tests.
  • Prepares and administers medications ordered by the physician, fills pill boxes as ordered by the physician, changes dressings, applies bandages, removes sutures and other first aid procedures, performs IV Therapy in accordance with State Practice act; uses CPR skills when necessary.
  • Screens calls and walk ins; collects pertinent clinical information and relays it to the physician, implements orders as appropriate and documents observations and interventions in the medical record.
  • Maintains supplies & equipment and stocks and sterilizes instruments; practices OSHA safety standards; performs accurate, legal, and ethical documentation at all times.
  • Upon physician approval and authorization, calls in prescriptions to the pharmacy. Uses communication skills with appropriate medical terminology; and follows appropriate legal and ethical professional conduct. Completes internal certification to use the ChenMed Rx system to support physician medication dispensing.
  • Processes patient phone messages, returns calls and routes them to other team members as appropriate. Contacts patients to obtain and relay pertinent information from the physician.
  • Performs other duties as assigned and modified at managers discretion.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:

  • Knowledge of medical products, services, standards, policies and procedures
  • Excellent clinical skills to identify, diagnose and appropriately resolve patient issues
  • Good non-clinical skills to assist with dressing, physical exercise, restroom visits, etc. as needed
  • Good motor skills to effectively calibrate equipment, manipulate intravenous equipment, administer injections, position and transport patients when needed
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to effectively collaborate with team members, including physicians, clinicians, front desk staff, center managers, and market leaders
  • Mindset focused on solving problems for patients and achieving team goals
  • Skill in operating phones, personal computer, software and other IT systems. Must be detail-oriented to ensure accuracy of reports and data
  • Ability to maintain effective and organized systems to ensure timely patient flow
  • Ability to exercise patience, compassion and empathy for patients and family members
  • Ability to act calmly in busy or stressful situations
  • Good time management to ensure tasks are completed timely and efficiently
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook, plus a variety of other word-processing, spreadsheet, database, e-mail and presentation software
  • Ability and willingness to travel locally and regionally up to 10% of the time
  • Spoken and written fluency in English

At ChenMed,If you are an innovative, entreprenuerial minded, over-achiever who is extremely passionate in helping people and revolutionizing Healthcare again, we are that dynamic and exciting company you are looking for!

After applying, we encourage you to "follow" us on LinkedIn (ChenMed) as well! This way you can stay informed and up to date on whats happening around our organization and start your path to becoming part of our FAMILY!

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE CRITERIA:

  • High school diploma or equivalent required
  • Graduation from a nationally accredited school for practical or vocational nursing required
  • Current, active LPN license to practice in state of employment required
  • If required by employment States Board of Nursing, IV Therapy Certification required
  • CPR certification for Healthcare Providers required
  • A minimum of 1 year of work experience as an LPN required
  • A minimum of 3 years overall clinical experience is preferred
  • Experience working with geriatric patients is a plus
  • EMR system experience is preferred

By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Test (Denver, CO) (Remote Eligible)
job_description:
Okta is looking for a Software Engineer in Test to join our End User Experience Team for both automation and end-to-end testing. This team is responsible for Okta's End User Dashboard that makes it simple and secure for workforce users to get one click access to everything they need to get their job done. The ideal candidate will share our passion and great pride in the simple elegance and usability of our solution and will join an engineering team that strongly believes in automated testing and an iterative process to build high-quality enterprise software and service.


Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Develop test plans and automation for high-performance, scalable software components and APIs
  • Validate authentication related fixes
  • Automated test development, design and code reviews
  • Build end to end functional and automated test plans that cover customer scenarios
  • Work with the QA team and engineering management to scope and plan QA and test engineering efforts
  • Contribute to functional testing of new code
  • Design and implement scalable and reliable automated tests
  • Interface with Development, Technical Support, Documentation and UX teams

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities:

  • 3+ years of experience with Java-based test automation
  • Experience with testing UI's using Selenium and related technologies (React, Backbone.js, etc..)
  • Solid grasp of software engineering, test methodologies and automation tools
  • Ability to work with minimum supervision to deliver well-designed, high-quality test code on time

Nice to haves:

  • Experience with Spring, REST, Maven, EC2, Redis, MySQL and Tomcat desirable
  • Knowledge of network security, encryption, authentication and authorization
  • Experience in standard authentication and authorization protocols such as SAML, OAuth and OpenID

Education and Training:

  • B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or related field

Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At ADP we are driven by your success. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way. If success motivates you, you belong at ADP.
We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.
Sr. Director of Retirement Services Education & Training is responsible for management oversight of the participant education and client training functions across all products and market segments within ADP Retirement Services. This leader's organization consists of two groups: the National Participant Education Group and Client Training Group.
The National Participant Education Group, which includes 4 regionally-based teams of FINRA-licensed Education Specialists and a team of Marketing Consultants, is tasked with driving retirement plan participation and deferral rates among client employees through the delivery of education programs. Each regional team is led by a Director/Manager - a licensed Principal under the ADP-Broker Dealer.
The Client Training Group is responsible for development and execution of retirement plan training curriculum for clients (Plan Sponsor and/or Plan Administrator) across all small, mid and large-sized clients, delivered both on-site and remotely.
Primary responsibilities are to establish goals and provide direction to the organization to meet revenue targets by growing participation/enrollment and salary deferral rates among new and existing clients; develop revenue plan, manage territories and organize the pursuit of opportunities across the client base to ensure revenue goals are met; create enrollment and education standards, policies and procedures to support/enhance the value of education and training services to clients and participants; act as a licensed "Principal" for the
ADP-Broker Dealer and ensure that the Retirement Services Education Specialists (RSES) are in compliance with FINRA rules and regulations.
Other major responsibilities include:
  • Drive high client satisfaction and retention levels among clients
  • Increase utilization of ancillary services to help increase client retention
  • Manage budget (including a large travel expense)
  • Design and implement new initiatives, projects and procedures to improve productivity and efficiencies, and enhance current products and services
  • Promote new products
  • Create policies and procedures
  • Establish strong, collaborative relationships with internal and external partners (Sales, Implementation, Client Services, Operations, Financial Advisors, Registered Investment Advisors, and other partners)
  • Enhance the overall Client Experience through all interections (written, verbal, online, etc.)
  • Motivates employees to reach high standards of performance by establishing an environment that encourages and recognizes diligence, dedication and a sense of mission.
  • Provides career development of employees through direct performance feedback and job coaching

Mutual Funds, ERISA compliance, QKA Designation, CEBS Status, Payroll

More than 12 years Experience in account management, client service, implementation, transformation, eductation & training or sales and ability to interact effectively with sales and financial advisor community.

job_description:
Retail Sales Associates

Join the Rally House team and SHOW YOUR COLORS!! No matter who you root for Rally House offers a diverse workplace, excellent career path plus sportswear and gear to advance your personal and professional game.

Why Rally House? Our stores offer a 40% off discount, friendly environment, flexible schedule and comfortable shopping experience, with associates dedicated to helping customers find the perfect new item to represent their team! We want to be more than just another sports apparel and gift store, and our team helps us stand apart from the competition. We don't just provide jobs; we provide careers - places to grow. The key to creating our premium experience is our people. Our focus is to hire people who are passionate about sports and helping customers. Premium associates who maintain or exceed our standards of excellence help bring our brand to life in-store and online and by taking great care of our customers.

Position Summary

Fashion Sales Associates help with basic operational and transactional functions to keep our stores game day ready! Responsibilities include: engaging with customers to enhance their shopping experience and help meet their shopping needs, merchandising product to keep the sales floor organized and appealing, and assisting at the cash register. Sales Associates also handle a variety of operational duties as assigned by the Store Management Team (i.e. housekeeping duties, visual presentation standards, fold merchandise, etc.). The Fashion Sales Associate will refer all duties, which require managerial experience and/or approval to the Sales or Store Manager.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Sales: Proven ability to generate sales, add-on and develop relationships with customers
  • Customer Service: Ensures that the customer remains the top priority
  • Store Operations and Organization: Ability to organize and move merchandise, prioritize assignments and meet deadlines Merchandising: Knowledge of visual standards and techniques, and ability to implement and maintain within guidelines
  • Accuracy: Ability to handle cash and provide change without error. Ability to prepare deposit as necessary. Captures accurate information for all transactions including signatures, addresses, and original receipt data
  • Communication: Communicates effectively with Customers, Members of Management, and Store Associates
  • Flexibility: Flexibility in scheduling to meet the needs of the business

Qualifications

  • Retail clothing experience preferred
  • Must be sales focused, exude high energy, and have an outgoing personality
  • Excellent communication and analytical skills
  • May be asked to lift and carry up to 30 lbs.


RH is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer


Part Time

job_description:
Job Title: Machine Operator I

Summary of the Position:

The machine operator I operates and maintains one simple machine or one machine line and ensures it is running efficiently with minimum supervision.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Sets up machine-loading and monitors to ensure it is running efficiently.
  • Follows work order, quality controls and sanitation procedures concerning weights, packs, descriptions, dates UPC’s, cleanup and changeovers.
  • Performs quality control and material waste checks.
  • Directs/instructs machine line personnel in specific job duties.
  • Performs pre-operational checks.
  • Maintains and exceeds production, quality and safety standards.
  • Loads product into hopper.
  • Cleans machine properly after production runs or changeovers.
  • Maintains a clean, organized and safe work area.

Qualifications:

  • Prior manufacturing work experience is a plus
  • Prior industrial truck experience a plus.
  • Prior machine operator experience a plus.
  • Capable of following verbal and written directions.
  • Good manual dexterity, vision and mobility
  • Ability to frequently lift and/or move up to 35 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 60 pounds.
  • Basic math skills
  • Ability to speak and read in English
  • Mechanical ability

job_title: Operational Risk Sr. Officer - Fraud Policy & Governance Oversight
job_description:
Job Description

Important Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as 'Personal Cell' or 'Cellular' in the contact information of your application.

At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers' financial needs and help them succeed financially. We're looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you'll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

Corporate Risk helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. The team focuses on several key risk types, including conduct, credit, financial crimes, information security, interest rate, liquidity, market, model, operational, regulatory compliance, reputation, strategic, and technology risk. The group provides leadership, enhances communications, assists with problem identification and solutions, and shares best practices. In addition, the group provides an enterprise-wide view of risk, assists management and our Board of Directors in identifying and monitoring risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and takes appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.

The Operational Risk Sr. Officer will report to the Fraud Policy and Governance Oversight Leader (Operational Risk Senior Manager) within Operational Risk Management. The role will operate as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in conducting fraud oversight of all business groups. Engagement with both business leaders and fraud leaders to understand fraud and ID Theft program coverage to ensure fraud risk is being evaluated, reported and mitigated in accordance with the Fraud Risk Management Policy and Identity Theft Prevention Program. In addition, the officer will augment current team oversight processes through engagement across program oversight processes, including identity theft prevention, policy management, fraud risk and control assessments, and independent risk assessments. The officer will engage business and regulatory partners.

Primary Responsibilities, but not limited to:

  • Provide strategic vision and execution of oversight processes related to the identity theft prevention program, fraud risk management policy management, and operational risk assessments
  • Support all policy management oversight responsibilities for both the Fraud Risk Management and Identity Theft Prevention Program Policies owned by Operational Risk. Assist in identifying opportunities to enhance policies and monitoring activities.
  • Serve as Identity Theft SME for front line and second line business partners and regulators.
  • Integrate findings and outputs to inform an independent view of the fraud risk profile for Identity Theft risks across all products.
  • Develop strong working relationships with senior management and risk and compliance partners across all key business and risk groups within fraud ecosystem
  • Develop and maintain industry partners/network to benchmarks processes and trends
  • Provide operational risk credible challenge across business groups to applicable fraud risk management processes
  • Review the findings of internal audits and regulatory exams related to enterprise fraud risk oversight. Lead Fraud Independent Risk Management (IRM) oversight of action plans to address deficiencies or recommendations associated with fraud risk, and coordinate with team to communicate with internal audit or regulators.

Preferred locations for this position are Charlotte, NC; Minneapolis, MN; Des Moines, IA; Phoenix, AZ; Dallas, TX, St. Louis, MO, New York, NY.
Relocation assistance is not available for this position


Required Qualifications

  • 10+ years of experience in risk management (includes compliance, financial crimes, operational risk, audit, legal, credit risk, market risk, IT systems security, business process management) or 10+ years of financial services industry experience, of which 7+ years must include direct experience in risk management
  • 5+ years of fraud prevention experience

Desired Qualifications

  • Experience developing and cultivating professional relationships
  • Ability to articulate issues, risks, and proposed solutions to various levels of staff and management
  • Ability to influence and collaborate at all internal organizational levels
  • Ability to prioritize work, meet deadlines, achieve goals, and work under pressure in a dynamic and complex environment
  • Advanced Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint) skills
  • Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
  • Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
  • Strong project management skills
  • Strong strategic and conceptual thinking skills

Other Desired Qualifications
  • Fraud and Identity Theft Program experience and expertise
  • Experience and subject matter expertise in fraud, financial crimes, or information security in a front line, second line or audit related role
  • Subject matter expertise in fraud typologies, fraud losses and drivers, industry fraud measurement metrics, industry fraud detection systems/process, fraud regulatory requirements/guidance and fraud controls with specific focus on identity theft
  • Certified Fraud Examiner designation and fraud industry involvement

Job Expectations

  • Ability to travel up to 10% of the time

Street Address

NC-Charlotte: 401 S Tryon St - Charlotte, NC
MN-Minneapolis: 600 S 4th St - Minneapolis, MN
MO-Saint Louis: 1 N Jefferson Ave - Saint Louis, MO
IA-Des Moines: 800 Walnut St - Des Moines, IA
AZ-PHX-Central Phoenix: 100 W Washington St - Phoenix, AZ
TX-Fort Worth: 201 Main St - Fort Worth, TX
NY-New York: 150 E 42nd St - New York, NY

job_description:
The Salvation Army, an internationally recognized non-profit, faith based organization, has a job opening for a part-time Pre-School Teacher for the Naples Corps, located in Naples, Florida.

Job Summary
Provides pre-school services for children including personal care, hygiene, learning and development activities and specialized programs; plans, develops, and teaches pre-school classes; prepares and maintains records; maintains cleanliness and orderliness of child care property.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Knowledge of the principles and practices of Child Behavior and Development. Knowledge of the principles and practices of early childhood curriculum development. Knowledge of the principles and practices of First Aid and C.P.R and ability to ensure the safety of children. Knowledge of the difficulties faced by children of substance users. Ability to teach children Christian values as well as general early childhood education curriculum. Ability to plan, develop, and implement effective childhood programs and activities.

Education and Experience
High School Diploma or GED, AND Two years experience teaching child development programs in a church or pre-school, OR Any equivalent combination of training and experience which provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.

Licenses and Certifications
Valid State Driver’s License
Approved Salvation Army Motor Vehicle Report required
First Aid and CPR certification.
45 hour DCF required training.

Physical Requirements and Working Conditions
Ability to meet attendance requirements. Ability to read, write, and communicate the English language. Ability to observe children and ensure their safety. Ability to lift, hold, and carry children on a regular basis (up to 50 lbs.). Duties are usually performed by combinations of sitting, standing, and walking on a frequent change basis.

Work is performed in a normal pre-school environment where there are little or no physical discomforts associated with changes in weather or discomforts associated with noise, dust, dirt, and the like.

Additional Information
All employees recognize that The Salvation Army is a church and agree that they will do nothing as an employee of The Salvation Army to undermine its religious mission.

To apply, please select the “Apply Now” icon at the bottom if this posting.

Application submittal period: 09/28/2020 – 10/12/2020

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

When an application is selected for review, typically, only applicants who indicate the relevant education and experience requirements, as indicated in the job description for the position, may be considered for job openings. Please FULLY complete the application, answer questions completely, honestly and to the best of your ability. Please also upload a copy of your resume (when available). Those applicants requiring accommodation to the application and/or interview process should contact a representative of the Human Resources Department at the applicable location.

We appreciate your interest in employment opportunities with The Salvation Army!

job_description:
Worker Type:

Employee

Maintains and repairs the facility’s structure, equipment and grounds, including plumbing, electrical and HVAC systems. Performs skilled trades work, such as carpentry or painting in the construction, repair or alteration of structures such as walls, roofs or office fixtures. The Facilities Specialist works with manufacturing or process engineering in the installation or repair of building plumbing and wiring required in the production process. Additionally, makes periodic or special inspections of the premise to determine repair work necessary and works from blueprints, drawings or rough sketches.

Work schedule includes on call rotation.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Operate, monitor, control, maintain, and respond to abnormal or unexpected conditions in facilities systems (electrical, mechanical, and control).
  • Support startup, commissioning, and integration of new equipment and systems into facilities infrastructure.
  • Provide operational and maintenance insights into design review process.
  • Fully functional and self-directed.
  • Provides formal mentorship.
  • Owner of highly complex assignments.
  • Regularly leads self and established as specialist.
  • Ability to understand the “big picture” and adjust work accordingly.
  • Plans work schedules.
  • Coordinates large work projects.
  • Performs small refrigeration work.
  • Coordinates/plans equipment changes.


SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
N/A

RECRUITING INFORMATION
Specific hiring needs may vary by location, industry, client, internal department and other business related factors. The qualifications section lists examples that may be used as guidance when populating required and preferred skills sections of recruiting requisitions/job postings.

QUALIFICATIONS

Required

· Advanced proven knowledge of facility maintenance.

· Computer proficiency

· Associate's degree, trade school certification, or equivalent practical experience.

· 2 years of experience at journeyman or technician level in a critical environment.

· Ability to work differing work rotations/shifts and non-standard work hours.


Preferred

· Data center, hospital, or power plant experience.

· Knowledge of the electrical and mechanical systems used in a data center environment, including: Feeders, Transformers, Generators, Switchgear, UPS systems, ATS/STS units, PDU/PMM units, Chillers, Air handling units and CRAC units.

· Ability to learn quickly and address issues as they arise during normal working hours or when on-call.

· Ability to communicate intelligently and effectively with contractors who perform maintenance or upgrade work on these systems.

· Ability to perform physical labor.

· Ability to perform preventative maintenance functions.

· Ability to obtain licenses and certifications as needed (backflow, boiler, etc.).

· Demonstrated ability to plan equipment layout.

· Knowledge of electrical repairs (ballasts, switches, receptacles).

Primary Location City/State:

Tempe, AZ, Arizona

Additional Locations (if applicable):
